title: Woman fatally shot inside a vehicle near Twain and Maryland identified
content:
LAS VEGAS (KSNV News3LV) — A woman was shot inside a vehicle about 4:30 a.m. Sunday in the central valley in what Metro says appears to be an accidental shooting.
The Clark County Coroner's Office identified the victim as 22-year-old Maryann Rofail of Anaheim, Calif. Her official cause of death was a gunshot wound of side and the manner was ruled a homicide.
The shooting occurred in the 3700 block of Cambridge, near East Twain Avenue and just west of South Maryland Parkway, according to Metro.
The victim was transported to Sunrise Hospital but died after arrival.
The investigation initiated by Metro's Homicide Section indicated the victim and her female friend were in a parked vehicle with two males they had met while attending a New Year’s Eve event, according to a Metro news release. While inside the vehicle, investigators believe a firearm was handled and accidentally discharged, striking the female victim.
At this time, no arrests have been made and this remains and ongoing investigation. Once completed, this case will be submitted to the Clark County district attorney’s office for review and consideration of criminal charges
This is the first homicide investigated by Metro in 2017.
Anyone with information is urged to contact Metro’s Homicide Section at (702) 828-3521 or homicide@lvmpd.com. To remain anonymous, contact Crime Stoppers at (702) 385-5555 or www.crimestoppersofnv.com, or text CRIMESNV plus tip information to 274637 (CRIMES). Message and data rates may apply.
Tips leading directly to an arrest or indictment processed through Crime Stoppers may be eligible for a cash reward.
